description: FDIC chairman Martin Gruenberg says he's prepared to step down once a successor is confirmed. Gruenberg has been widely criticized for fostering a toxic workplace at the agency.
title: Biden will name new boss soon to lead "toxic" FDIC

description: The AI company said the voice was not patterned after Johansson, but that it was removing the voice as an option in the wake of speculation about whether the sci-fi film inspired the voice.
title: OpenAI pulls AI voice that was compared to Scarlett Johansson in the movie 'Her'

description:
Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has died in a helicopter crash, according to state media. Here's how his death might contribute to instability in Iran and the region.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org. Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
title: What to expect next after the sudden death of Iran's president

description: Iran's president, foreign minister and other officials have died in a helicopter crash. President Raisi was the top elected official in Iran and seen as a possible successor to the Supreme Leader, who has has ultimate power over the government. We'll hear the details from Iran and analysis of what happen next in Iran's government.
title: Iran's President Dies, What Happens Next?

description: The conservative Cicero Institute is working with states to ban street camps, and shift money away from housing to addiction treatment. Homelessness advocates says such moves are counterproductive.
title: Amid record homelessness, a Texas think tank tries to upend how states tackle it

description: The prosecutor at the International Criminal Court in The Hague said he will seek arrest warrants for Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, Defense Minister Yoav Gallant and three Hamas leaders.
title: The International Criminal Court is seeking warrants for Israeli and Hamas leaders

description: The TV ad leans on the Affordable Care Act's popularity among independent voters and alludes to Biden's edge over Trump on health issues.
title: Biden accuses Trump of 'coming for your health care' in new campaign ad

description: The seafood chain is in hot water after a series of bad choices by a parade of executives. Almost 580 restaurants will stay open, after dozens closed abruptly last week.
title: Red Lobster files for bankruptcy after missteps including all-you-can-eat shrimp

description: Mohammad Mokhber worked in state-affiliated financial organizations before entering politics. He will lead the Iranian government until its presidential election, which must take place within 50 days.
title: What to know about Mohammad Mokhber, who is stepping in as interim president of Iran

description: Former South African president Jacob Zuma has been barred from contesting in next week's elections, South Africa's top court ruled Monday.
title: Jacob Zuma banned from running in South Africa's election

description: Former Trump lawyer andonce-loyal ally Michael Cohen is still on the witness stand testifying about his relationship to Trump, the Trump family and negotiations with adult film star Stormy Daniels.
title: Trump's New York criminal hush money trial continues into a fifth week of testimony

description: The pills for adults and school-aged kids aren't the right dose for preschoolers. Plus they taste bad. Now there's a new pill for little ones — but it seems like an uphill battle to get it to them.
title: A new pill cures preschoolers of a parasitic worm. Delivering it could be a challenge

description: Oversharing can make children vulnerable to identity theft, harassment and predators. To protect their privacy, share a 'holiday card-or-less' amount of data online, says expert Leah Plunkett.
title: Why you should think twice before posting that cute photo of your kid online

description: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi has been declared dead in a helicopter crash. As Michael Cohen's cross-examination wraps up, here's why the verdict in Trump's trial could come down to sex and privacy.
title: Iran's president dies in helicopter crash; Michael Cohen's cross-examination wraps up

description: New research shows lifelong bikers have healthier knees, less pain and a longer lifespan, compared to people who've never biked. This adds to the evidence that cycling promotes healthy aging.
title: Like to bike? Your knees will thank you and you may live longer, too

description: The Trump's Trials team breaks down why prosecutors have a timeline problem, what Michael Cohen's testimony so far has shown, and why it may all come down to a question of sex and privacy in the end.
title: How does Trump's trial end? It may hinge on how jurors feel about sex and privacy

description: In 2006, Patricia Nieshoff's three-year-old son had a seizure. She was a single mother, with no one to accompany her to the hospital. But an hour into her hospital stay, a familiar face appeared.
title: She was a single mom, alone at hospital with her son. Then a familiar face appeared

description: Some otters rely on tools to bust open hard-shelled prey items like snails, and a new study suggests this tool use is helping them to survive as their favorite, easier-to-eat foods disappear.
title: When sea otters lose their favorite foods, they can use tools to go after new ones

description: Rwanda's post-genocide transformation has been remarkable, but uneven. And it prompts many questions, including: what type of leader is needed to help a country grow and heal?
title: Rwanda is transforming and growing — but at what cost?

description: Iran's ultraconservative president, killed in a helicopter crash, oversaw a crackdown on women's protests and was linked to extrajudicial killings in the 1980s.
title: Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi, a hard-liner who crushed dissent, dies at 63

description:
Scientists are testing the limits of artificial intelligence when it comes to language learning. One recent challenge? Learning ... whale! Researchers are using machine learning to analyze and decode whale sounds — and it's just as complicated as it seems.

Curious about other mysteries of nature? Email us at shortwave@npr.org.
title: Sperm whale families talk a lot. Researchers are trying to decode what they're saying

description: Taiwan's new President Lai Ching-te in his inauguration speech has urged China to stop its military intimidation against the self-governed island Beijing claims as its own territory.
title: Taiwan's new president urges China to stop its military intimidation
